widget.tooltip: The Stripe system expects a client secret API key function. This field is expected to be filled with that secret API key.
widget.help: You get a secret API key whenever you register an account with Stripe. That key has to be copied here. Remember that it has to remain secret. Do not copy it anywhere else.

widget.tooltip: The number of times the system will try to pass a recurring fee before it stops trying.

widget.label: Run in Debug mode. (WARNING: when Debug is turned on, no real charges are performed.)
widget.tooltip: Check this box to run in debug mode. This means you can pass orders without actually making real payments.
widget.help: The Debug mode is useful for you to make sure that everything is functional. Stripe offers a debug account that everyone can use without you having to do anything more than check this box.

widget.tooltip: The Stripe system also gives you a secret key for test purposes. This is useful if you want to make sure things work before you actually change your stripe system to live and run real credit card tests.
widget.help: You get a live and a test secret API key whenever you register an account with Stripe. That test key can be copied here. It is only required if you want to run tests to make sure that your website is working. Remember that it has to remain secret. Do not copy it anywhere else.
